page.title: 08TRAFFIC FLOW SURVEY
page.content: We surveyed 2 roads.London road is a main road used for long distance and through traffic.Mackie avenue is a surburban road with local traffic going to and from Patcham. The time the counts were done were 1:45-2:15pm(London rd) and 2:40-3:10pm(Mackie av).There were 1418 vehicles per hour on the London rd at what was expected to be a quiet time .The Brighton by-pass is being built to reduce the amount of traffic going through Brighton.There were many lorries mostly Northbound because they came from the South Coast ports. Mackie Avenue had 262 vehicles per hour with no lorries as there is no destination for them on a housing estate.The traffic is light as it is only local.The London rd divides our survey area into 2 and has a major influence on the Patcham area.
